skills.name: Solve problems involving adding a period of time on to a given start time

explanations.A: Look carefully at the order in the question.
explanations.C: There are 100 cm in 1 metre, and 1000 mm in 1 metre.
explanations.D: There are 100 cm in 1 metre, and 1000 mm in 1 metre.

explanations.A: Look carefully at the order in the question.
I think you used the wrong operation. Will there be more ml or l?
explanations.B: Look carefully at the numbers and units in the question.
explanations.C: If 1000 ml = 1 l, how many ml are equal to 10 l?

explanations.A: Adding on 15 minutes takes us to 11:00, then another 2 hours to 13:00, and then the final 25 minutes gives us 13:25.
explanations.B: Almost! How do we write 1pm on the 24 hour clock?
explanations.C: Can you have 85 minutes past 12? How many minutes are in an hour?
explanations.D: Nearly. How many minutes did it take to get from 10:45 to 11:00? How many of the 40 do we still have to add on?

explanations.A: Nearly. How many minutes did it take to get from 09:25 to 10:00? How many of the 50 do we still have to add on?
explanations.B: Can you have 75 minutes past 12? How many minutes are in an hour?
explanations.C: Almost! How do we write 1pm on the 24 hour clock?
explanations.D: Adding 35 minutes takes us to 10:00, adding 3 hours takes us to 15:00, then the last 15 minutes gives us 13:15.

explanations.A: 1 millilitre is equal to 1 cm³. How many millilitres are in a litre?
explanations.B: 1 millilitre is equal to 1 cm³. How many millilitres are in a litre?
explanations.C: 1 millilitre is equal to 1 cm³, and 1000 ml = 1 l, so we have 5 × 1000.
explanations.D: 1 millilitre is equal to 1 cm³. How many millilitres are in a litre?

explanations.A: 1 millilitre is equal to 1 cm³. How many millilitres are in a litre?
explanations.B: 1 millilitre is equal to 1 cm³, and 1000 ml = 1 l, so we have 4 × 1000.
